fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45488].
  {panel}

h5 Problem Definition
When a user on the Security-level add watchers, those users cannot browse/edit the issue because they aren't on the Security-level (which they should never be on _unless_ they need to be part of that specific issue discussion). 

To get around this we currently use a custom field ('User Picker') that allows users to be added to field, which is a field set to the Security-level needed to browse/edit the issue.

I have searched Atlassian documentation and plugins, and have not seen a solution for this.

h5. Suggested Solution
Have watchers added to the issue security levels
fields.summary: Add Watchers to Issue Security Level

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45487].
  {panel}

As JRA-36670 and its many duplicates illustrate, JIRA users are wasting countless hours and nerve cells on typing comments that disappear when an escape button is accidentally pressed, while Atlassians are losing karma and wasting hours on explaining why they are not going to make the escape action warn users about losing two pages of carefully typed text.

There is no need for this suffering and waste!

Leave escape behavior as it is now -- quick and easy. Add a personal history of a few last canceled text edits. If I just wasted an hour on a disappeared comment, I would be very happy to go to some obscure page and copy-paste my lost comment from there.

Good UX. No UI complications at all. And no users that hate you for making their text disappear. Yes, adding a personal history of canceled comments requires work, but that is not an excuse to avoid fixing a serious UX problem, is it?
fields.summary: lack of cancellation history

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45480].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
As a user and Admin, I would like to be able to get notifications when a user is given Administrative permission(added to jira-administrator group or given the global permission for that group).
The reason for this is it allows us monitor how many Admins there are on the system and in the case of a breach such as someone breaching the system and adding a user to the admin group, when we get notified, System Admin can know there has been a breach.

*Suggested Resolution*
Add notification feature that is triggered when a user has been given Admin permission, should there be a database breach of the JIRA instance, once JIRA indexes and notices this change, it should send out a notification.
fields.summary: Send notification to System Admin if Someone is given Admin Privilege

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Activity Stream is displaying work logs for all users that have been restricted. This is allowing any user to see possibly sensitive information in those work logs that should not be seen otherwise.

Raised as a critical due to this. This was previously raised in [-STRM-2130-|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/STRM-2130] which indicates it's fixed in JIRA 6.0, however it's still present in 6.4.11.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new group.
# Create a new user.
# Assign that user to the group.
# Create a new project.
# Edit the project permissions to add the 'Work On Issues' permission to the group from step 1.
# Create an issue with the admin user.
# Login as the user from step 2.
# Log work on the issue created (this was tested with group vs project role, this can be enabled in [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options]).
# Access that issue with a user that does not have access to those worklogs. They won't be able to see them in the issue.
# Access the project activity stream.

h3. Expected Results

The work log messages are not displayed in the Activity Stream as they are not displayed in the View Issue screen.

h3. Actual Results

Restricted work logs are viewable in the Activity Stream. These are *not* visible on the dashboard however are on project activity streams.

h3. Notes

No known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Activity Stream displaying log work when the visibility is restricted

h5. Problem Definition
When viewing the count of group member in the Application Access page (_Administration > Applications > Application Access_), JIRA will display only the currently active users members of the group and not the total member count.

This could be misleading, specially if users click on the group name and get redirected to the Users page and see a different user count there which contains the inactive users.

*Issue Summary*
As a user, I would like to be able to restrict what fields are visible to users when they search for issues in the issue navigator page.

Users should not be able to see statuses from issues that are restricted to them.

*Steps to Reproduce*
- Create 2 projects in JIRA
-- Set one to be restricted to select users either through project permission or security level.
-- Set the other to be visible to anyone.
- Create a custom workflow with custom Statuses for project one and assign it to the project.
- Go to the issue search page to search issues.
- Add a condition that has statuses

*Expected Result*
Statuses in the restricted project are not visible for selection

*Actual Result*
All statuses are viewable(can be seen) by all users.

h5. Summary
This feature request is similar to JRA-2993 but for active users. Regardless of the respective notification scheme for projects I would like to be able to turn off all email notifications that JIRA sends out to active users. This feature is helpful when a user is e.g. on vacation or parental leave and does not want to sieve through a pile of outdated emails upon their return. 

The solution proposed several times already on Atlassian Answers to change the user's email address is not a viable option since it does not work for on-demand instances with SSO functionality.

A similar functionality appears to exist in Confluence, cf. CONF-26865.

h5. Suggestion
Allow e-mail notifications to be temporarily disabled for active users.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45442].
  {panel}

It would be useful to allow a custom field to be created which links to a confluence page.

This functionality does exist within the "linked issues" field, however my use case requires something a little different.

I would like to be able to have a workflow condition that a transition cannot be performed unless the field "Standard Operating Procedure Document Link" is filled out. Sure, I can throw the URL of the confluence page in there, but I'd like my application link to be able to search confluence for the relevant doc.

I'm sure I could perhaps also have a condition to check that there is a standard "Linked Issue" present but this field is likely to already be filled by links to IT & Infrastructure tickets.

For some context, this is an effort to improve IT/Infra documentation across our organisation. We have a JIRA Infrastructure Change Management project where risk assessments are written for IT/Infra changes which have various conditions and approval steps etc. We want it so that the last step is to create a Standard Operating Procedure document, without which, the JIRA task cannot be marked as resolved.

This could perhaps be done as an enhancement to the existing "Multi Issue Selector" custom field type, whereby there would be an additional context type of "Confluence Link".

Bob Swift would nail this in a flash, I'm sure.
fields.summary: Allow Multi Issue Selector Custom Field to link to Confluence pages.

I searched the issues and have found related tickets but none of them were addressing my question:

Would it be possible with Git to show all commits from a branch related to an issue in the Source tab?
It only seems to aggregate commits if the commit message includes the PROJECT-#### issue ID pattern

We follow that convention only with branch names and while that works fine and links the branch in Stash to the issue on the Development dash and the other way around, both the Development dash and the Source tab only shows commits the messages of which explicitly refer to the issue.

I understand it may not be trivial/feasible to collect commits that from a certain branch. I was thinking of something like _git log PROJECT-1234-the-branch --not <all the other branches>_

Thanks!
fields.summary: Source tab to show commits based on branch name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* In v6.3.15, when moving an issue to a different project where the logged in user does not have "Assign Issues" permission the user is automatically assigned to the default for the new project
* Doing the same after the upgrade in 6.4.11, the moved issue still have the original asignee although he is not an "Assignable User" in the new project.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 Projects with 2 separate permission schemes ( Project A & B )
# Create 2 users User A and User B
# In the  permission schemes for Project B, make sure that User A is not given the "Assignable User" permission
# Confirm this by trying to assign an Issue from Project B to User A. User A *must* not be able to be the assignee of that issue. 
# Create an issue from Project A , Assign it to User A. 
# Move the issue to Project B
# Take note that the assignee of the issue did not change. It is still User A who does not have the "Assignable User" permission in Project B. 

h3. Expected Results
#  Assignee of moved ticket is automatically assigned to the Default Assignee for the new project

h3. Actual Results
# The assignee of the issue did not change. It is still User A who does not have the "Assignable User" permission in Project B.
fields.summary: Assignee not changed when moving issues between projects with different permission schemes

fields.description:
On of my developers reported an issue which so far can only be confirmed between 2 specific projects when a specific link type is created. 

There are 2 ways in which I've encountered this issue:
1) Under Project B user creates issue B-1 & while on the Create Issue screen links the issue as "is contained by" to issue A-1 in Project A. I personally watched this & also saw the Linked Issues field with "is contained by" & "A-1" there. I also saw in the Activity tab of A-1 where the user created the link. After a couple of hours the user went back to B-1 & the Linked Issues field was missing. The field was also missing on A-1, however on A-1 you can still see the link in the Activity tab.
2) While creating issue B-2 _I believe_ I also included a link to A-2 as "is contained by". Later I noticed that B-2 & A-2 weren't linked, so I created the link. After another couple of days I noticed that B-2 & A-2 weren't linked, so I created the link, but this time I remembered that I had already done this so I checked the Activity tab in B-2 and could see both of the times I linked these 2 tickets after creating B-2.

Note: This doesn't happen with Project C or D, where C & D are structurally copies of B (set up the same, with same roles, permissions, issue types, & workflows).
fields.summary: Issue "is contained by"/"contains" link field disappears from Default screen after creation

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45404].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JIRA Agile Scrum project running
# Set your close transition to use "Resolve Issue" screen
# Transition any issue to the close status
# The Resolve issue screen will show up
# Fill out the assignee to other user
# Type "aaa" on the time spent (just to show some error on the screen) and hit resolve
# Go back and type "1m" on the time spent and hit resolve

*Expected Results:*
The issue will be marked as resolved and the assignee will be the one you set on step 5.

*Actual Results:*
The issue is marked as resolved *but* the assignee is set to myself instead of the one set on step 5.

*Workaround:*
Before hitting resolve for the second time, make sure to re-type the chosen assignee.

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA v7.0.0-OD-05-005
JIRA Agile v7.0.2-D20150904T042837

*Notes:*
The problem does not happen if you type everything correct on the first time.
This only happens if you face any error when filling out the information on the screen.
fields.summary: "Assignee" field won't retain value when resolving issue faces a problem

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45402].
  {panel}

*Issue Summary*
When a user sets multiple Workflows in a Workflow scheme for a project with each associated with a different issue type as [described here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-workflow-schemes-302809197.html], when they create an issue, the option to Select issue type shows all Issue Types.
When however they go to the view issue screen and try to change the issue type, the option available to them are only those Issue Types associated with that particular Workflow.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a couple of Workflows and associate each to specific set issue types.
#- For example Bugs and suggestions only. 
# Associate the Workflows with a Workflow Scheme and associate this with a project.
# Create an issue and select Bug.
# In the View issue screen(if you have the issue type field in edit scree), attempt to change the issue type.

*Expected Result*
All issue types are available for selection.

*Actual Result*
Only issue types associated with that workflow are available.

*Workaround*
Use the move issue feature found under more to change the issue type to other issue types.
fields.summary: JIRA should show all available issue Types rather than those available to a particular issue Type when editing the issue in View issue Screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the same *new* value is added on issue create screen for both Affected Version and Fix Version, the value will be create twice.

h3. Environment

JIRA Server 6.3.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create  a new issue
# Select a new value for affected version
# Select the same value for Fix version
# create issue

h3. Expected Results

One value for the suggested version should be created

h3. Actual Results

Two values are being created.

h3. Notes
See screen recording.
fields.summary: Adding the same new value for Affected Version and Fix Version during Issue Create will create duplicate Version values.

fields.description:
h3. Summary When attempting to add the 'Text' gadget in JIRA (as setup through [Adding the Text Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Text+Gadget]), if a large block of text is used Tomcat will not be able to serve the request as it exceeds the maximum header size. This results in a blank text gadget appearing and the gadget can no longer render. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Add a text gadget as per [Adding the Text Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Text+Gadget]. # Populate it with the below: {code}
2-Pager Jira Epic Brief Description
Analysis
EG-POTATOBAKE-1 POTATOBAKE-32 Cook Delicious Baked Cookies
EG-POTATOBAKE-2 POTATOBAKE-68 Reticulate Spines
EG-POTATOBAKE-3 POTATOBAKE-70 Choose a decidedly optimal garnish
EG-POTATOBAKE-5 POTATOBAKE-45 Research turkey bacon
EG-POTATOBAKE-6 POTATOBAKE-234 Design portfolio
Exception Handling
EG-EXCP-1 POTATOBAKE-206 Change Control
Journals
EG-JCA-10 POTATOBAKE-25 Create Agile Board
EG-JCA-11 POTATOBAKE-26 Pancakes or Muffins?
EG-JCA-2 POTATOBAKE-47 Are scrambled eggs really the absolute best?
EG-JCA-3 POTATOBAKE-23 Change the epic colour
EG-JCA-7 POTATOBAKE-24 Add it to livejournal
Migration & Deployment
EG-MIG-1 POTATOBAKE-251 Create MySpace page
Publish & Request/Response
EG-PUB-2 POTATOBAKE-245 Merge code to Netscape trunk
EG-PUB-7 POTATOBAKE-240 Create a 'stamp'. Like, an actual stamp. For stamping paper. Because reasons.
User Interface
EG-UI-1 POTATOBAKE-79 Optimise UX for printing functionality
{code} # Reload the page. h3. Expected Results The gadget renders normally. h3. Actual Results This depends how JIRA is being accessed, and also the configuration of any reverse-proxy and JIRA. * If directly (i.e.: no proxy is used), the HTTP request returns a 400 and the page rendering breaks - it appears blank. * If a proxy is being used, the proxy may return an error such as 'Request-URI Too Long' as per the attached screenshot. * Additionally if the proxy is being used, it's possible a 'Bad Request' may be displayed instead of the blank page if the proxy is configured to allow the large request however Tomcat is not. h3. Workaround h5. Workaround1 Include the page from remote server. # Create html at remote server and save content # Include that page into gadget instead of whole html block, you can use * {code} h5. Workaround2 Increase the limits. The limit on the HTTP request needs to be addressed on anything between JIRA and the client that the traffic may go through - for example if using Apache, the limit must be increased in Apache and *also* in Tomcat (JIRA). h5. Apache # Edit the appropriate configuration file (this may be {{httpd.conf}}, it depends how you've configured Apache). # Increase the [LimitRequestLine|http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/core.html#limitrequestline] to something larger, for example {{16380}}. # Reload or restart Apache. An example of this is below: {code} ServerAdmin captain-planet@example.com ServerName orion-pax.example.com ErrorLog "/usr/local/var/log/apache2/orion-pax.office.com-error_log" CustomLog "/usr/local/var/log/apache2/orion-pax.office.com-access_log" common ProxyRequests Off ProxyPass / ajp://localhost:8009/ ProxyPassReverse / ajp://localhost:8009/ LimitRequestLine 16380 {code} h5. Tomcat # Stop JIRA. # Edit the {{server.xml}} to set the {{maxHttpHeaderSize}} to be larger in the appropriate Connector as per the example below: {code} {code} # Restart JIRA. (!) We were not able to reliably workaround this problem using an AJP connector and a proxy. The attempted steps tried were: # Increase the {{packetSize}} in {{server.xml}} as per the below: {code} {code} # Restart JIRA. It appears the Apache proxy was not able to handle the request - increasing the [ProxyIOBufferSize|http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_proxy.html#proxyiobuffersize] allowed this to work intermittently (in some cases all gadgets were returned blank), however was not reliable enough for a functional workaround. It is suggest instead to move from AJP to HTTP. Potentially another proxy such as nginx could handle this better however was not tested. h3. Notes This occurs as the HTTP request puts the entire contents inside the query parameters, for example: {noformat} http://orion-pax.office.atlassian.com/jira6411/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mid=10107&country=US&lang=en&view=default&view-params=%7B%22writable%22%3A%22true%22%7D&st=atlassian%3AIp0Pz%2FsvtiRKUZJ9ULQ0h47hVkDZQtlg6ewlqd24SlhKgH8kDUWHQKZPHkL7%2B9%2B3snPSa2KwiBZ%2F0njglesxOzk95VWjoqSZDYe1OWc%2BQ%2FvuYtVofIwBeim0DNKCcfKGey%2BlBHjvVeMZwxLRVeRRIFK7iV%2Fpu8DQTCCzvy7LlprWmEq1wPdxlz3pz%2FwRLxSm405tVXP3tURjJdprb1cWUT7NExFmmg2kENz8hAVpgdpY6nGHDpRrEe2ziozIswfHXHHUkVyK133a%2BaWqRBMwW%2FZ6GHENisfaobdzfun%2FS5OSgZRU&up_isConfigured=true&up_html=%3Ctable+style%3D%22border%3A+3px+solid+gray%3B+border-spacing%3A+0%3B%0D%0Aborder-collapse%3A+collapse%3B+padding%3A5px%22%3E%0D%0A%0D%0A%3Ctr+style+%3D+%22background-color%3A+%23D3D3D3%3B+border-bottom%3A+1px+solid+gray%3B%22%3E%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3E%3Cb%3E2-Pager%3C%2Fb%3E%3C%2Ftd%3E%0D%0A%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3E%3Cb%3EJira+Epic%3C%2Fb%3E%3C%2Ftd%3E%0D%0A%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3E%3Cb%3EBrief+Description%3C%2Fb%3E%3C%2Ftd%3E%3C%2Ftr%3E%0D%0A%0D%0A%3Ctr+style%3D%22border-bottom%3A+1px+solid+gray%3B%22%3E%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3E%3Cb%3EAnalysis%3C%2Fb%3E%3C%2Ftd%3E%0D%0A%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3E%3C%2Ftd%3E%0D%0A%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3E%3C%2Ftd%3E%3C%2Ftr%3E%0D%0A%0D%0A%3Ctr+style%3D%22border-bottom%3A+1px+solid+gray%3B%22%3E%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3EEG-POTATOBAKE-1%3C%2Ftd%3E%0D%0A%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3EPOTATOBAKE-32%3C%2Ftd%3E%0D%0A%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3ECook+Delicious+Baked+Cookies%3C%2Ftd%3E%3C%2Ftr%3E%0D%0A%0D%0A%3Ctr+style%3D%22border-bottom%3A+1px+solid+gray%3B%22%3E%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3EEG-POTATOBAKE-2%3C%2Ftd%3E%0D%0A%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3EPOTATOBAKE-68%3C%2Ftd%3E%0D%0A%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3EReticulate+Spines%3C%2Ftd%3E%3C%2Ftr%3E%0D%0A%0D%0A%3Ctr+style%3D%22border-bottom%3A+1px+solid+gray%3B%22%3E%3Ctd+style%3D%22padding%3A5px%22%3EEG-POTATOBAKE-3%3C%2Ftd%3E%0D%0A%3Ct h3. If an issue is assigned to a user named "unassigned" and you perform the JQL query assignee = empty. Results will come back for the user "unassigned" and issues that are unassigned. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable debug logging for the class com.atlassian.jira.issue.search .
# Create user unassigned (with assignable user permission for the project). 
#  Create 2 issues one that is assigned to the user "unassigned" and an issue that is not assigned.
#  Perform Query 1: assignee = empty
# Perform Query 2: assignee = unassigned
# Both return the same results.

h3. Expected Results
# Query 1 would result in issues that are actually unassigned.
# Query 2 will return results of issues assigned to the user "unassigned"

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the catalina.out file:
{noformat}
assignee = empty

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When restoring a backup from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server the import fails and the user is requested to import the backup again.
\\
h3. Environment
Migrating from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server
\\
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export a backup from a JIRA Cloud instance where none of the avatars are .svg files.
# Install JIRA Server 6.4.11.
# Try to import a backup from Cloud (tested on 7.0.0-OD-02-247) into JIRA Server.

h3. Expected Results
The backup would be imported with no problems.

h3. Actual Results
The import fails and the user is prompted to re-import the data. The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2015-09-12 04:08:18,224 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 DEBUG roshan 247x213x1 stpbzd 10.148.71.82 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [mysema.query.sql.AbstractSQLQuery] query : select AVATAR.id
from avatar AVATAR
where AVATAR.avatartype = ? and AVATAR.systemavatar = ? and AVATAR.filename in (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
2015-09-12 04:08:18,232 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 DEBUG roshan 247x213x1 stpbzd 10.148.71.82 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [query.sql.dml.SQLInsertClause] update project
set avatar = ?
where project.avatar in ()
2015-09-12 04:08:18,250 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR roshan 247x213x1 stpbzd 10.148.71.82 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Expected 1 paths, but got 2
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Expected 1 paths, but got 2
        at com.mysema.query.sql.dml.AbstractSQLClause.setParameters(AbstractSQLClause.java:102)
        at com.mysema.query.sql.dml.SQLUpdateClause.createStatement(SQLUpdateClause.java:113)
        at com.mysema.query.sql.dml.SQLUpdateClause.execute(SQLUpdateClause.java:154)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.DowngradeTask_Build70024$2.run(DowngradeTask_Build70024.java:188)
        at com.atlassian.jira.database.DbConnectionManagerImpl.execute(DbConnectionManagerImpl.java:122)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.DowngradeTask_Build70024.downgradeProjectIcons(DowngradeTask_Build70024.java:139)
        at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.DowngradeTask_Build70024.downgrade(DowngradeTask_Build70024.java:103)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DowngradeWorker.runDowngradeTask(DowngradeWorker.java:158)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DowngradeWorker.downgrade(DowngradeWorker.java:94)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.executeDowngradeTasks(DefaultDataImportService.java:860)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:782)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:332)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:65)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:177)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:148)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat} 

h3. Notes
Please see internal notes for data to reproduce the problem and further investigation.

h3.Workaround
# Extract the backup zip file;
# Edit the {{entities.xml}} file;
# Search for an entry of 'rocket.png'. It should look like the following:
{code:XML}
    <Avatar id="XXXXX" fileName="rocket.png" contentType="image/png" avatarType="project" systemAvatar="1"/>
{code}
# Change it to:
{code:XML}
    <Avatar id="XXXXX" fileName="default.svg" contentType="image/png" avatarType="project" systemAvatar="1"/>
{code}
# Save the file;
# Zip the {{entities.xml}} and {{activeobjects.xml}} files again;
# And try to restore the backup.
(!) Make sure to provide a license key so you won't be affected by JRA-45187.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45386].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
On Page:
- https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis

The Wording under the Distribution column for *JIRA REST APIs* notes:
{quote}
JIRA Cloud / JIRA Server (EAP)2
{quote}

The way this is worded looks as though it could have two possible meanings and is not clear to end users:
- JIRA Cloud instances and JIRA Server as (EAP) separately
-- JIRA Cloud
-- JIRA Server (EAP)
- JIRA Cloud instances and JIRA server both as (EAP)
-- JIRA Cloud (EAP)
-- JIRA Server (EAP)

The Correct meaning Should clearly state thes two options are Separately identified

h3. Suggested Solution
Word as:
{quote}
JIRA Server (EAP) and JIRA Cloud
{quote}

OR

Add in an additional column for Server EAP and Cloud respectively
fields.summary: Confusing wording on JIRA APIs documentation

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*
Currently, when some users upgrade their UPM version to 2.19.X, their Manage Add-on page and at time Add-ons page do not show the contents expected to be in them.

*Steps to Reproduce*
* There are 3 scenarios this problem occurs.
** Upgrade JIRA UPM plugin from 2.18.X to 2.19.x.(Most common)
** Fresh install of JIRA with the latest UPM version.
** Upgrade JIRA and UPM to latest version.
* After one of the scenarios mentioned above, user should proceed to the {{manage add-on}} page

*Expected Result*
The JIRA will show all plugins the user has installed.

*Actual Result*
JIRA would show the manage Add-on page however the Contents (installed plugins) would not show up and the section for it is broken.
Also, the button to {{Upload Add-on}} would be missing. 

*Workaround*
Downgrade UPM to version 2.18.4 using the manual method as detailed below:
- Download [Universal Plugin Manager|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.upm.atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin/versions]
- Stop JIRA
- Go to {{..\JIRA HOME\plugins\.osgi-plugins\transformed-plugins}}
- Delete the plugin {{atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin-XXXXXXXXXX.jar}} (Where XXX is the version number however just search for Universal plugin Manager)
- Go to {{..\JIRA HOME\plugins\installed plugins}}
- Delete the plugin {{atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin-XXXXXXXXXX.jar}} (Where XXX is the version number however just search for Universal plugin Manager)
- Go to {{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/bundled-plugins/}}
- Delete the plugin {{atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin-XXXXXXXXXX.jar}} (Where XXX is the version number however just search for Universal plugin Manager)
- Place the downloaded JAR file in the installed plugins folder {{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/bundled-plugins/}}
- Restart JIRA.
_This would install plugin in JIRA._

*Resolution*

Upgrade to UPM 2.20.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45371].
  {panel}

See my [question here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/22653271].

h1. Case 1 - Arrays (copied)
Most of the standard custom fields that JIRA ships have meta data that says they are arrays with string values. That normally means you need to provide a JSON array of option ids. Cascade select is a odd case even though it reports the same schema but needs to be handled differently. It has historically been an odd case (wink).  

The trouble is for an arbitrary custom field that reports meta data as "array" and with items of "string" there doesn't seem to be a way to know the format or content of the data that is expected to set the value of the field. Am I missing something here? One would assume meta data would give you enough information to determine that, but it doesn't. Providing an array of values results in an error. How does one create a representation of data for an arbitrary custom field that represents itself as accepting array values but does not? Also, what indication is there that it needs option ids instead of regular strings? This seems like an omission from the metadata available.

For instance, the agile custom fields look like arrays, but don't accept array values:

schema": {
"type": "array",
"items": "string",
"custom": "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-epic-link",
"customId": 11261
}, 

customfield_11261": "ZAGILE-1",

h1. Case 2 - 3rd party custom fields
Here is a Tempo field with the following metadata:
{noformat}
"customfield_10600":{"required":true,"schema":{"type":"account","custom":"com.tempoplugin.tempo-accounts:accounts.customfield","customId":10600},"name":"Account","hasDefaultValue":false,"operations":["set"]},
{noformat}

This happens to be a numeric field. However, there is no indication of that in the metadata. 
Worse, an update using a string value gives "not numeric" error even though the string value is actually a numeric value. There doesn't appear to be a generic way to determine that a numeric is required. The only obvious way is magically knowing about this specific custom field requires a numeric entry.
fields.summary: REST API issue metadata is not complete

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As of Java 1.8u51+ (also 1.7.0_85+ and 1.6.0_101+) making SSL connections to an IP address is no longer allowed.  Previously the JVM would do a reverse lookup of the hostname using the IP then complete the connection using that hostname.  This was a security vulnerability because an attacker that gained control of DNS could route traffic to their own server.  This change is a security feature of Java.

We have found there is a problem with the way Java creates LDAPS connections.  The way Socket.createSocket() is used results in an SSLSocket without the hostname set in it.  This results in use of an IP address to make the connection and since this is no longer allowed the connection fails.  We have reported this problem to Oracle and also forwarded the information to the Java security dev list: http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/security-dev/2015-September/012845.html .

Because of this _*existing LDAPS connections are broken*_ and users from that user directory are unable to login including non-local administrators.

This will affect any customer using secure LDAP that upgrades the JVM.  Secure LDAP is very common to protect passwords on the internal network, particularly in enterprise environments.  This is exacerbated by JIRA 6.4.11 which ships with 1.8u51.

h3. Environment
* Verified: JIRA 6.3+ using the noted Java versions.
* Suspected: All versions of JIRA using a noted Java version.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a user directory using a secure LDAP connection
# Upgrade the JDK to a noted Java version.


h3. Expected Results

Logins and LDAP syncs should work as normal.

h3. Actual Results

Users will be unable to authenticate and LDAP syncs will fail.

Errors like this will occur in the logs: {code:borderStyle=solid}
2015-07-22 12:43:05,896 WARN  [http-bio-443-exec-1] @1SDVDDx763x1x0 XXXXX "POST /j_stash_security_check HTTP/1.1" c.a.s.i.s.s.PluginAuthenticationProvider Could not authenticate XXXXX; authentication by com.atlassian.stash.stash-authentication:crowdHttpAuthHandler failed
com.atlassian.stash.user.AuthenticationSystemException: The remote authentication server is not available. Please try again later.
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.crowd.RiotPolice.authenticate(RiotPolice.java:113) ~[stash-service-impl-3.11.1.jar:na]
	at com.atlassian.stash.internal.user.DefaultUserService.authenticate(DefaultUserService.java:108) ~[stash-service-impl-3.11.1.jar:na]
...
	... 21 common frames omitted
Caused by: org.springframework.transaction.CannotCreateTransactionException: Could not create DirContext instance for transaction; nested exception is org.springframework.ldap.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636; nested exception is javax.naming.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636 [Root exception is javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: java.security.cert.CertificateException: No subject alternative names matching IP address XXXXX found]
	at org.springframework.transaction.compensating.support.AbstractCompensatingTransactionManagerDelegate.doBegin(AbstractCompensatingTransactionManagerDelegate.java:90) ~[spring-ldap-core-2.0.2.RELEASE.jar:2.0.2.RELEASE]
...
	... 22 common frames omitted
Caused by: org.springframework.ldap.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636; nested exception is javax.naming.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636 [Root exception is javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: java.security.cert.CertificateException: No subject alternative names matching IP address XXXXX found]
	at org.springframework.ldap.support.LdapUtils.convertLdapException(LdapUtils.java:108)
...
	... 39 common frames omitted
Caused by: javax.naming.CommunicationException: <DNS.NAME>:636
	at com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.<init>(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
	at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapClient.<init>(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
...
	... 43 common frames omitted
Caused by: javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: java.security.cert.CertificateException: No subject alternative names matching IP address XXXXX found
	at sun.security.ssl.Alerts.getSSLException(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
	at sun.security.ssl.SSLSocketImpl.fatal(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
...
	... 58 common frames omitted
Caused by: java.security.cert.CertificateException: No subject alternative names matching IP address XXXXX found
	at sun.security.util.HostnameChecker.matchIP(Unknown Source) ~[na:1.8.0_51]
...
	... 67 common frames omitted
{code}
 
h3. Suspected Cause

Crowd  is resolving DNS name into IP and then connects to LDAP server using the IP instead of the hostname. As a result, the underlying Java code tries to compare the destination IP with the DN in the certificate.

If this is verified as the cause then the same issue will occur when the reverse-lookup IP doesn't match DN in certificate (DNS1 -> IP -> DNS2). This situation is quite common.

h2. Fix: install a Java version equal to or newer than 1.8u65

Java version 1.8u65 contains a fix [JDK-8133196|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8133196] which addresses the problem described in this issue.  Please see [How to Use System JRE Instead of Embedded JRE|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/How+to+Use+System+JRE+Instead+of+Embedded+JRE] for instructions to change the version of Java that JIRA runs with.

h3. Workaround

(!) Only necessary if you do not upgrade your Java JDK.  If your version of JIRA does not support Java 8 or you cannot upgrade to 1.8u65 a workaround is necessary.

h5. Add JVM startup parameter {{-Djdk.tls.trustNameService=true}}

This reverts back to the older Java behavior while preserving all the other security related changes in the newer Java release.  Your LDAP data will still be encrypted.  The risk is described by Oracle in their explanation of the change at http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/8u51-relnotes-2587590.html.

h5. Disable SSL check

 Under the LDAP connection "Advanced Settings" set "Secure SSL" to disabled*.  As stated in the UI this will disable all verification of the SSL certificate.  Your LDAP data will still be encrypted.  (!) This workaround may represent a greater vulnerability as any SSL cert could be substituted with no need to compromise a DNS server.
fields.summary: Secure LDAP connections are broken when using Java 1.8u51, 1.8u60, 1.7.0_85+ and 1.6.0_101+

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45361].
  {panel}

There are two issues reported related to this, JRA-16595 & JRA-39112, but I thought I'd put a general suggestion that encompasses the whole problem.

h3. Problem
As long as the user has create issue permission in a project, they can move an issue to it and more importantly, to ANY workflow state in the target workflow. This creates an issue in a use case such as:

-If you are using in a project (or specific issue type) a workflow that has specific restrictions as it is being used in a strict approval process. The ability to use the move issue operation to "bypass" any workflow conditions and validators renders the approval workflow useless. (not saying that someone would necessarily maliciously seek to do so)

-Similarly, it could be moving to a different issue type within the same project that is using a different workflow as well. 

Looking at the consequences mentioned in the other linked issues, simply put, the "move issue" operation is one could say "too powerful" as it doesn't respect workflow conditions and permissions in the target project.

h3. Solution

Removing create issue permissions to a project or move issue permissions is in a lot of cases not really an option and therefore not a solution.

What would be a solution apart from all conditions and permissions being taken account by the code, would be the ability to disable moving TO a project/issue type either via permission or otherwise so that at least any really problematic cases can be avoided.

h3. Workarounds?

At least for my case I am looking at whether it is impossible to employ a hack to remove certain projects or issue types from the ui dialogue similar to https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=301663662.
fields.summary: The move issue operation should respect workflow restrictions and permissions in target project or issue type.

h3. Summary
If the user opens the Issue Creation dialog (and probably other dialogs/screens with an user selector) and opens the dropdown in 'Assign Issue' multiple times, every time the number of users is duplicated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 15-20 users in JIRA 6.5-OD-07, ensure all of them are able to be assigned issues (you need enough users to cause the user list in the Assign Issue dialog to have to scroll).
# Create a new JIRA issue.
# Click Assign, then hit the dropdown arrow in the Assignee field.
# Scroll down (using the keyboard or trackpad/mouse, it doesn't matter) to the bottom of the 
list
# Close the dropdown
# Repeat steps 3 to 5 a few times

h3. Expected Result
The list of users is constant

h3. Actual Results
Every time the user opens the dropdown, the lists of users contains more duplicated users.
fields.summary: Opening the dropdown for "Assign issue" duplicates the number of users in that list

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

The name no longer really reflects what it does. What the setting actually does is change the attachment security policy. The default level is a default (secure) attachment level which uses a blacklist of content-types which are sent as attachment downloads, the "insecure" level simply sends all attachments "inline" and the "secure" attachment level sends all attachments as downloads.

h3. Suggested Solution

Rename this something more appropriate as per how the functionality works.
fields.summary: Rename the Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy

  {panel}

h3. Summary

Attempting to submit feedback via an issue collector using IE11 on Windows 7 fails. The issue is not submitted and the screen remains greyed out.
h3.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to an issue collector in IE 11 (or use the attached index.html containing existing collector embed code)
 # If prompted, elect to "Allow Blocked Content"
 # Click the "Report Feedback" link
 # Fill in the minimum required fields
 # Click the "Submit" button

h3. Expected Results

Issue is submitted and created.
h3. Actual Results

The submit seems to lock up. It never returns from the submit to inform the user that the feedback was submitted.

Using the IE debugger reveals the following failure when the submit is clicked:
SCRIPT5: Access is denied.
File: batch.js, Line: 431, Column: 4108
h3. Notes

The browser is getting an exception in jQuery Form Plugin (v. 2.67 from 2011). 
h3. Workaround

Use another browser.
fields.summary: Issue Collector Fails in IE 11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-45340].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

If an exception occurs during the processing of a thumbnail (such as a corrupt jpg), JIRA will not record the failure, and the next time the resource is requested, it will generate it (and fail) again.

Typically on those issue that failed due to the condition:
{noformat}
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272460500 2015-09-11 21:24:41,267 ajp-nio-127.0.0.104-8009-exec-1063 WARN sysadmin 1283x137820x1 t77wfs 202.68.74.170,104.192.141.33 /browse/DD-108 [c.a.j.issue.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager] Error writing to thumbnail file: /data/jirastudio/jira/home/data/attachments/TEST/10000/TEST-108/thumbs/_thumb_45662.png1391332809470942590.tmp
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272467500 com.atlassian.jira.issue.attachment.AttachmentReadException: Remote blobstore couldn't provide an input stream for attachment 45662: java.awt.image.RasterFormatException: (y + height) is outside of Raster
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272795500 	at sun.awt.image.ByteInterleavedRaster.createWritableChild(ByteInterleavedRaster.java:1248)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272796500 	at sun.awt.image.ByteInterleavedRaster.createChild(ByteInterleavedRaster.java:1208)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272797500 	at com.twelvemonkeys.imageio.plugins.jpeg.JPEGImageReader.readImageAsRasterAndReplaceColorProfile(Unknown Source)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272800500 	at com.twelvemonkeys.imageio.plugins.jpeg.JPEGImageReader.read(Unknown Source)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272800500 	at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.scaleImage(Thumber.java:231)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272800500 	at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.createThumbnail(Thumber.java:291)
2015-09-11 21:24:41.272812500 	at com.atlassian.core.util.thumbnail.Thumber.retrieveOrCreateThumbNail(Thumber.java:270)
{noformat}

h3. Expected Result

This should be tracked even in the event of catastrophic failure (such as OOME taking down the application), and thus the attempt should be recorded and committed before the attempt, not after.

When it fails, it should disable the thumbnail from being generated again by marking {{thumbnailable}} on the {{fileattachment}} table to 0

h3. Actual Result

It will take a very long time to load the issue, and fail the page load. Multiple reload will still hit into the same issue. Potential piling up the memory if it keeps loaded.

h3. Workaround

Identify from the error message which image is causing the error, for example in the above error it is image id 45662. Shut down JIRA, take a backup of the database and then run:

{noformat}
update fileattachment set thumbnailable = 0 where id in (<image ids you identified above>)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Failing to generate a thumbnail should remember that the operation failed

h3. Problem Definition
Using the basic screen, select due date, and then select the "now overdue" option. The JQL that is auto-generated is set to >=0. This gives you issues that are due "today", when actually I'm only interested in things that are due before today.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the query 'Overdue' do show issues from one day before.

h3. Workaround 
Use the advance search and edit the query.
fields.summary: Due Data 'Overdue' shouldn't bring issues from the day
